column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Why can't we have these in California?!? I guess then it wouldn't be considered Chicago deep dish
column2: my point is that I love this place. My first time with Lou was when it was shipped out to me in Los Angeles
column3: even frozen and heated in my own oven it was delicious
column4: but nothing compares to the fresh one. Everything couldn't be more harmonious
column5: the tomatoes in the sauce has a perfect sweetness that compliments the saltiness of the cheese and meats
column6: and oh that crust. I still don't understand how the bottom remains crispy and not soggy. I eat and eat and it makes me sad that I can only fit 2 slices in my belly. The most amazing part of the whole experience is that this pizza tastes fresh and never greasy
column7: it truly couldn't be more distinct!
